meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be held, maintained, or defended.
meanings.sent1: Her tenabilities in debate class impressed everyone with her strong arguments.
meanings.sent2: The tenabilities of the fortress were tested during the enemy's siege.
meanings.sent3: The knight's tenabilities to protect the kingdom were put to the test in the battle.
meanings.sent4: The tenabilities of the legal system to uphold justice were questioned by the public.
meanings.sent5: The tenabilities of the rope to support the weight were crucial for the climber's safety.

meanings.definition: The capacity to be able to be justified or supported.
meanings.sent1: His tenabilities in explaining complex theories made him a respected professor.
meanings.sent2: The tenabilities of the evidence presented in court were crucial for the verdict.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's tenabilities to make absurd situations seem logical amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The tenabilities of the argument to sway opinions were evident in the heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The tenabilities of the bridge to withstand the storm were tested by the engineers.

meanings.definition: The ability to be able to be believed or accepted.
meanings.sent1: Her tenabilities in storytelling captivated the children during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The tenabilities of the rumor to spread quickly surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tenabilities to pretend innocence while causing mischief amused the family.
meanings.sent4: The tenabilities of the conspiracy theory to gain followers were concerning.
meanings.sent5: The tenabilities of the excuse to convince the teacher were questionable.
